column4: I asked this earlier but my problem still isn't fixed so I'll ask again:
Grub doesn't kick in after installing Ubuntu. What can I do? I tried "install-grub" but the command wasn't found. I tried Auto Super Grub Disk for Windows but that didn't do anything.
on a live cd open a terminal and run sudo grub
the livecd lets you edit local files, sudo grub loads the grub terminal and you can find and repair grub, or install it if it is missing
